definition: to look after/to take into consideration/to attend to
to take care of/to show consideration/to attend to/to look after
to attend simultaneously to two or more things/to balance (career and family, family and education etc)
to take into consideration/to attend to
fears of trouble in the rear (idiom); family worries (obstructing freedom of action)/worries about the future consequences/often in negative expressions, meaning "no worries about anything"
solely preoccupied (with one thing)/engrossed/focusing (on sth)/to look after only one aspect
honor does not allow one to glance back (idiom); duty-bound not to turn back/no surrender/to pursue justice with no second thoughts

sentences.english: Look after your own house, O David!
sentences.chinese: 大衛家阿，自己顧自己吧。

sentences.chinese: 樓道里的燈泡壞了，顧媽媽上樓時摔了一跤。

sentences.english: Buildings in order to comfort LuoTianMing, her about doing had tea together.
sentences.chinese: 顧阡陌爲了安慰駱天明，她約小春父子倆一起喝茶。

sentences.english: Let's check what we had for polar coordinates.
sentences.chinese: 我們來回顧一下極座標。

sentences.english: Typically a garbage collector is optimised for one or the other.
sentences.chinese: 垃圾收集器通常兩者只能顧其一。

sentences.english: Gu Yan's novels about knowledge women's life have distinct pure literature tendency.
sentences.chinese: 顧豔知識女性題材小說具有鮮明的純文學傾向。

sentences.english: When the four Weasels felt that they were free from harm they walked toward the chicken coop.
sentences.chinese: 這四隻黃鼠狼覺得後顧無憂，就朝着雞圈走去。

sentences.english: Every man for himself, and the devil take the hindmost .
sentences.chinese: 人人顧自己，落後者遭殃。

sentences.english: LuoXiaoChun wouldnt want to, but he invited from mother to his restaurant chefs.
sentences.chinese: 駱曉春不肯要，但他邀請顧媽媽到他的餐館做大廚。

sentences.english: She devotes all her spare time to looking after her sick mother.
sentences.chinese: 她把所有的空餘時間都花在賜顧幫襯生病的母親上。

sentences.english: Foreign teachers visit the Historian, Mr. Gu Yanwu's home.
sentences.chinese: 我院外教訪問顧史學家炎武先生故居。

sentences.english: Gu was born in Guangdong Province.
Danis is looking after his friend"s house this week."
sentences.chinese: 丹尼斯這個星期要幫他朋友顧房子。

sentences.english: Salatin says he would need another full-time staffer.
sentences.chinese: 薩拉丁說要是想申請，可能得再顧一名全職員工纔行。

sentences.english: Gu buildings tell Liang Yuhan myself always wanted to do the real reason for civil servants.
sentences.chinese: 顧阡陌告訴梁宇涵自己一直想做公務員的真正原因。

sentences.english: You must take good care of themselves, the work will not be too hard.
sentences.chinese: 你必然要賜顧幫襯好本身，工作不要太負責。

definition: to agree (to do sth)/should/ought to/must/(legal) shall
to answer/to respond/to comply with/to deal or cope with
Zheng state during the Warring States period/surname Zheng/abbr. for 鄭州|郑州[Zheng4 zhou1]
after all/all in all/when all is said and done/in the final analysis
to link/to join/to connect/continuously/in succession/including/(used with 也[ye3], 都[dou1] etc) even/company (military)
but/yet/however/while/to go back/to decline/to retreat/nevertheless/even though
still/still in progress/still more/yet/even more/in addition/fairly/passably (good)/as early as/even/also/else
to stop/to cease/to dismiss/to suspend/to quit/to finish
bosom/heart/mind/to think of/to harbor in one's mind/to conceive (a child)
only/merely/no more than/but/however/anyway (to get back to a previous topic)/cannot be more (after adjectival)
